page.title: 04FROM THE BURDONS TO TODAY
page.content: Roland Burdon II opened up Castle Eden Dene and helped the old and sick by founding the Castle Eden Friendly Society to produce insurance cover for 70 years.In 1792 he helped start a textile factory employing over 200 which failed because of the French war.The factory clock is now used by the local brewery.Real wealth came to the area when mining spread from East Durham in the 19th century.Families came from all over England to work in the mines at Maria Pit-Castle Eden colliery,Heselden and Wingate colliery both sunk in 1840.In 1893 flooding closed the Maria Pit but Wingate worked until 1962.In the 1950's plans were made to build Peterlee New Town to provide up to date housing and to attract new blood to the area.There was a great deal of initial resistance to the idea.
